notesStmt.note: Edge damage, surface abrasion, tears, and losses. Text partly illegible.
Some old patches with red rot.
Dark, hard or stretchy edges from manufacture.
Pleats and folds occasionally obscure text.
Some parts very wormed at edges and joins.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 226; ruled lines: 51; written lines: 51; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point. Visible pricking and stiching. Made up of a number of fragments pieced together. 226 columns in total, one to seven columns per membrane. No tagin, except for three tagin on שעטנזגץ in Ex. 14:28-20:21. The letter ח is arched in some of the fragments. Majuscular and minuscular letter in accordance with the rules. Special shape of the letter פ occurs frequently, inverted נ is placed before and after Num. 10:35-36. The "puncta extraordinaria" placed on the words fixed by masorah.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square script of the 15th century.
